params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number of the target block.

returns._0: L2 timestamp of the given block.

params._l2OutputIndex: Index of the first L2 output to be deleted.                       All outputs after this output will also be deleted.
Index of the output to return.

returns._0: The output at the given index.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: First checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: Index of the first checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._finalizationPeriodSeconds: The minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal                                   can be finalized.
params._l2BlockTime: The time per L2 block, in seconds.
params._startingBlockNumber: The number of the first L2 block.
params._startingTimestamp: The timestamp of the first L2 block.
params._submissionInterval: Interval in blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.

returns._0: The number of outputs that have been proposed.
The index of the next output to be proposed.

params._l1BlockHash: A block hash which must be included in the current chain.
params._l1BlockNumber: The block number with the specified block hash.
params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number that resulted in _outputRoot.
params._outputRoot: The L2 output of the checkpoint block.

CHALLENGER().notice: Getter for the challenger address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `challenger` instead.

FINALIZATION_PERIOD_SECONDS().notice: Getter for the finalizationPeriodSeconds.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `finalizationPeriodSeconds` instead.

L2_BLOCK_TIME().notice: Getter for the l2BlockTime.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `l2BlockTime` instead.

PROPOSER().notice: Getter for the proposer address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `proposer` instead.

SUBMISSION_INTERVAL().notice: Getter for the submissionInterval.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `submissionInterval` instead.

challenger().notice: The address of the challenger. Can be updated via upgrade.

computeL2Timestamp(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 timestamp corresponding to a given L2 block number.

constructor.notice: Constructs the L2OutputOracle contract. Initializes variables to the same values as         in the getting-started config.

deleteL2Outputs(uint256).notice: Deletes all output proposals after and including the proposal that corresponds to         the given output index. Only the challenger address can delete outputs.

finalizationPeriodSeconds().notice: The minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal can be finalized.

getL2Output(uint256).notice: Returns an output by index. Needed to return a struct instead of a tuple.

getL2OutputAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 output proposal that checkpoints a given L2 block number.         Uses a binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given         block.

getL2OutputIndexAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the index of the L2 output that checkpoints a given L2 block number.         Uses a binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given         block.

l2BlockTime().notice: The time between L2 blocks in seconds. Once set, this value MUST NOT be modified.

latestBlockNumber().notice: Returns the block number of the latest submitted L2 output proposal.         If no proposals been submitted yet then this function will return the starting         block number.

latestOutputIndex().notice: Returns the number of outputs that have been proposed.         Will revert if no outputs have been proposed yet.

nextBlockNumber().notice: Computes the block number of the next L2 block that needs to be checkpointed.

nextOutputIndex().notice: Returns the index of the next output to be proposed.

proposeL2Output(bytes32,uint256,bytes32,.notice: Accepts an outputRoot and the timestamp of the corresponding L2 block.         The timestamp must be equal to the current value returned by `nextTimestamp()` in         order to be accepted. This function may only be called by the Proposer.

proposer().notice: The address of the proposer. Can be updated via upgrade.

startingBlockNumber().notice: The number of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

startingTimestamp().notice: The timestamp of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

submissionInterval().notice: The interval in L2 blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.

CHALLENGER().notice: Getter for the challenger address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `challenger` instead.

FINALIZATION_PERIOD_SECONDS().notice: Getter for the finalizationPeriodSeconds.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `finalizationPeriodSeconds` instead.

L2_BLOCK_TIME().notice: Getter for the l2BlockTime.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `l2BlockTime` instead.

PROPOSER().notice: Getter for the proposer address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `proposer` instead.

SUBMISSION_INTERVAL().notice: Getter for the submissionInterval.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `submissionInterval` instead.

challenger().notice: The address of the challenger. Can be updated via upgrade.

computeL2Timestamp(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 timestamp corresponding to a given L2 block number.

constructor.notice: Constructs the L2OutputOracle contract. Initializes variables to the same values as         in the getting-started config.

deleteL2Outputs(uint256).notice: Deletes all output proposals after and including the proposal that corresponds to         the given output index. Only the challenger address can delete outputs.

finalizationPeriodSeconds().notice: The minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal can be finalized.

getL2Output(uint256).notice: Returns an output by index. Needed to return a struct instead of a tuple.

getL2OutputAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 output proposal that checkpoints a given L2 block number.         Uses a binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given         block.

getL2OutputIndexAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the index of the L2 output that checkpoints a given L2 block number.         Uses a binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given         block.

l2BlockTime().notice: The time between L2 blocks in seconds. Once set, this value MUST NOT be modified.

latestBlockNumber().notice: Returns the block number of the latest submitted L2 output proposal.         If no proposals been submitted yet then this function will return the starting         block number.

latestOutputIndex().notice: Returns the number of outputs that have been proposed.         Will revert if no outputs have been proposed yet.

nextBlockNumber().notice: Computes the block number of the next L2 block that needs to be checkpointed.

nextOutputIndex().notice: Returns the index of the next output to be proposed.

proposeL2Output(bytes32,uint256,bytes32,.notice: Accepts an outputRoot and the timestamp of the corresponding L2 block.         The timestamp must be equal to the current value returned by `nextTimestamp()` in         order to be accepted. This function may only be called by the Proposer.

proposer().notice: The address of the proposer. Can be updated via upgrade.

startingBlockNumber().notice: The number of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

startingTimestamp().notice: The timestamp of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

submissionInterval().notice: The interval in L2 blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.

OutputProposed(bytes32,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Emitted when an output is proposed.

userdoc.notice: The L2OutputOracle contains an array of L2 state outputs, where each output is a         commitment to the state of the L2 chain. Other contracts like the OptimismPortal use         these outputs to verify information about the state of L2.

params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number of the target block.

returns._0: L2 timestamp of the given block.

params._l2OutputIndex: Index of the first L2 output to be deleted.                       All outputs after this output will also be deleted.

returns._0: The output at the given index.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: First checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: Index of the first checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._finalizationPeriodSeconds: The minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal                                   can be finalized.
params._l2BlockTime: The time per L2 block, in seconds.
params._startingBlockNumber: The number of the first L2 block.
params._startingTimestamp: The timestamp of the first L2 block.
params._submissionInterval: Interval in blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.

returns._0: The number of outputs that have been proposed.
The index of the next output to be proposed.

params._l1BlockHash: A block hash which must be included in the current chain.
params._l1BlockNumber: The block number with the specified block hash.
params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number that resulted in _outputRoot.
params._outputRoot: The L2 output of the checkpoint block.

params.l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number of the output root.
params.l2OutputIndex: The index of the output in the l2Outputs array.

params.newNextOutputIndex: Next L2 output index after the deletion.
params.prevNextOutputIndex: Next L2 output index before the deletion.

documentation.text: @notice The number of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.
@notice The timestamp of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.
@notice An array of L2 output proposals.

@notice The interval in L2 blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice The time between L2 blocks in seconds. Once set, this value MUST NOT be modified.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice The address of the challenger. Can be updated via upgrade.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice The address of the proposer. Can be updated via upgrade.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice The minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal can be finalized.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice Semantic version.
 @custom:semver 1.8.0

@notice Constructs the L2OutputOracle contract. Initializes variables to the same values as
         in the getting-started config.
